name: Theory and Practice in English/Chinese Translation
description: An introduction to the methods, techniques and major theories involves in translating from English into Chinese. This course emphasizes the translation practice and the theoretical discussions on linguistic, cognitive, socio-political, and cultural aspects of translation. Through analysis and application of translation theory, students practice the art of translation and develop awareness of issues that translators face. [24L, 12P]
prerequisites: CHI301Y5/CHI301H5, CHI302H5 OR appropriate language level indicated by language assessment questionnaire. Students must demonstrate language fluency and proficiency in both English AND Chinese.
